item.title: The Many Minds That Move Us
item.description: A reflection on why command-and-control thinking fails in complex systems, and why both minds and societies are shaped less by central intelligence than by emergent, plural agencies we’ve forgotten how to notice.
item.author: Daniel Fridgren

item.title: What Truly Matters Doesn’t Scale
item.description: Why dominant investment models overlook the slow, non-scalable investments that sustains resilience and long-term societal health.
item.author: Daniel Fridgren

item.title: On Culture And Adaptability
item.description: On cultural malleability, generational blind spots, and why societies adapt through cultural change rather than technology.
item.author: Daniel Fridgren

item.title: The Metaphors We Build Into Technology
item.description: How technologies reflect the metaphors of their time, and what ecological systems reveal about alternative ways of building.
item.author: Daniel Fridgren
